Cryptography.description:
I just studied practical cryptography and finally made my new web authentication token. Can you audit my code?

[https://tenjin.hackthesystem.pro](https://tenjin.hackthesystem.pro)

Author: merricx
hints:
Obviously **timing attack**, but what can you exploit from this?
Look at the most "time expensive" function.
Cryptography.name: Tenjin

Cryptography.description:
Faustian Contract was too easy. How about Mephistophelian Contract?

`nc 157.245.51.41 33370`

Author: merricx
hints: Sorry to ruin your day, but this one need LLL :'(
Cryptography.name: Mephisto

Forensic.description:
Another incident occured on my old webservice that originally hosted using a network proxy. Upon the inspection, I found that the dependencies seems to be deprecated. Luckily, there was nothing harmful happened. Could you figure it out?

Author: hanasuru
hints: It was affected by a popular CVE back in 2021 which likely had a capability to execute a malicious code to the server
Forensic.name: Proxyfied

Forensic.description:
It's been a while since the last incident. But those peaceful day surely didn't last long due to another silly incident. This time, we detected some suspicious traffic inside our VPN network. Fortunately, there were nothing major happened. Could you figure it out?

Author: hanasuru
hints: I forgot to say, but our service were hosted on an uncommon port. It might cause some issues when it comes to the packet analyzer though
That being said, our staff said that he found a leaked server config file when he was doing a packet replaying
Forensic.name: Remoted

Forensic.description:

Forensic.name: Kui R Kode

Reverse Engineering.name: Aplikasi Apa tuh

Reverse Engineering.description:
> Malware accident just happen to our company. We found out that our sysadmin tried to migrate our database with a tool that he find online. 

Luckily we caught all the traffic. Could you help us?

Attachment: [challenges.zip](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Npj2BjRsjRTt_uUzvLlGJsayP7_DJ-Js/view?usp=share_link)

Author: vidner
Reverse Engineering.name: Mainframeware

Web.description:
Yet another web fetcher challenge. Now with eval!

Author: farisv

**Please do not bruteforce/scan/fuzz/flood the website. If your solution works on local but not on the challenge server, please contact us via Discord.**
Web.name: Fetcheval

Web.description:
> Nahida sedang belajar menjadi webdev, dapatkah kamu periksa?

Challenge URL : https://akasha.hackthesystem.pro/
Attachment : https://bit.ly/ptakashabijaksentosa

Author: `cacadosman`

- **Please do not bruteforce/scan/fuzz/flood the website using public tools (example: sqlmap, gobuster, nikto, owasp zap, nessus, burp scanner, etc).**
-  **You are still allowed to bruteforce if you use your own script as long as it is not abusive (no multithread).**
- **If your solution works on local but not on the challenge server, please contact us via Discord.**
Web.name: PT Akasha Bijak Sentosa

Web.description:
This is one of our newest "as a service" project but it's still on development phase.

Author : Yeraisci

**Please do not 'heavily' bruteforce/scan/fuzz/flood the website. If your solution works on local but not on the challenge server, please contact us via Discord.**
hints: Read more research material and take a look on the "context" that being processed.
Web.name: List User as a Service

Web.description:
Previously I already publish my free hacking course and then I just realize that I still need money :(. Now I'm opening a donation on my wordpress with certain plugin and I'm using one other plugin but I don't know why do I need it tho. I hope no one can't use them to gain a vulnerability.

Main URL : https://ewp.hackthesystem.pro/

Bot : https://bot.ewp.hackthesystem.pro/
